name: Alina Zare
content: Faculty - Alina Zare – Machine Learning and Sensing Lab Faculty Alina Zare azare [at] ufl [dot] edu Professor Electrical and Computer Engineering Google Scholars Page Mathematics Genealogy Page Dr. Alina Zare has graduate faculty status and can advise PhD students or serve as an internal member on PhD committees from the following departments/schools: Electrical and Computer Engineering Computer & Information Science & Engineering School of Natural Resources & Environment Education Doctor of Philosophy in Computer Engineering University of Florida, Gainesville, FL December 2008 Ph.D. Thesis: Hyperspectral Endmember Detection and Band Selection using Bayesian Methods Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering University of Florida, Gainesville, FL August 2003 Appointments Director, Artificial Intelligence and Informatics Research Institute, University of Florida, Gainesville, FL Nov. 2024- Current Associate Dean for Research and Facilities, Herbert Wertheim College of Engineering, University of Florida, Gainesville, FL Aug. 2022- Nov. 2024 Professor, Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Florida, Gainesville, FL Aug. 2020 – Current Associate Professor, Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Florida, Gainesville, FL Oct. 2016 – Aug. 2020 Associate Professor, Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Missouri, Columbia MO Sept. 2016 Assistant Professor, Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Missouri, Columbia MO Sept. 2010 -Aug. 2016 Office of Naval Research Faculty Fellow, Naval Surface Warfare Center, Panama City, FL May – Aug. 2012 & May – Aug. 2013 Post-Doctoral Research Associate, Computational Science and Intelligence Lab, University of FL, Gainesville, FL Jan. 2009 – Aug. 2010 Publications Publication listing can be found here: Publications Projects Project listing can be found here: Projects Honors and Leadership SEC Academic Leadership Development Program Fellow, 2023-2024 Advanced Leadership for Academics and Professionals Participant, 2022-2023 H.E.R.S. Leadership Institute Participant, 2021-2022 Herbert Wertheim College of Engineering Teacher/Scholar of the Year, UF Herbert Wertheim College of Engineering, 2021-2022 Associate Editor, IEEE Transactions on Artificial Intelligence, January 2021 – Current Term Professorship Award, University of Florida, August 2021-July 2024 Faculty Service Excellence Award, UF Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, May 2021. Top 10% of high-scoring reviewers at Neurips 2020, October 2020. Faculty Research Excellence Award, UF Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, May 2020. Program Chair, Phenome 2020 Best Reviewer IEEE Transactions on Smart Grid, Jan. 2020. Best New Faculty Award UF ECE Graduate Student Organization, 2019 Graduate Recruitment and Admissions Committee Coordinator, Aug. 2019 – Aug. 2022 Program Chair, IEEE International Conference on Fuzzy Systems, July 2019 IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Society Education and IDEA Committee Member, Jan. 2019 – Aug. 2022 Rising Researcher Award SPIE Defense and Commercial Sensing, 2018 Outstanding Reviewer Recognition for IEEE Journal of Oceanic Engineering, 2017 Associate Editor, IEEE Trans. Geoscience and Remote Sensing, 2016-2021 Honored as an MU Top Faculty Achiever, March 2015 National Geospatial Intelligence Agency New Investigator Program Award, Oct. 2014 National Science Foundation CAREER Award, May 2014 MU College of Engineering Junior Faculty Research Excellence Award, Mar. 2014 IEEE Senior Member: Elevated to Senior Member of the IEEE, Feb. 2014 Program Chair, IEEE Workshop on Hyperspectral Image and Signal Processing, Jun. 2013 Best Reviewer Recognition for IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Letters, 2011 IEEE Geoscience & Remote Sensing Society Unsupervised Optical Data Fusion Contest Winner, 2009 Additional Related Links UF/IFAS AI and Data Science Seminar Series.
